Opening: ^A bead of sweat spatters onto a motivational leaflet Parker has been scribbling notes on. 'Your choices have consequences. Be the right kind of doctor,' it says.
^Parker reaches for a sponge he swiped from the O.R. and dabs his forehead. It does nothing to help. The sponge is already soaked.
^The room is buzzing with the whine of computer fans straining in the heat.
^Another doctor sits behind Parker, his scrubs dark with sweat.

^The windows in the office look out into the admitting bay. Beyond that lies the Acute Care Unit. Parker can hear the steady beep of monitors from within, ever so slightly muffled by the thickness of the hot air.

c-0: ^'CHECK ON BEN IN ROOM 706 BEFORE ROUNDS START.'
^It's only 07:30. Parker still has half an hour before rounds begin. That should be plenty of time to sneak up to 706 and check on Ben before his doctor sees him. Plenty of time.
g-0: ^Parker slides the patient notes into a folder and wakes his computer.
^The diagnostic information for the patient in room 706 is still open on his screen. A second tab is open to the national news.

BensNotes: ^Coma patient. Time under: 5 years, 7 months. Car accident.
^Currently conscious. Leg injury and muscular atrophy keeping patient bedridden.
News: ^The front page has three major articles.

c-0: ^'The heat wave afflicting the city heads into day 45 with no end in sight. Stores are closing their doors, trucks are being pulled off the road. Petrol prices are at their highest.
^In the northern hemisphere, temperatures are dropping to record lows.
c-1: ^The latest in a series of closures spanning the last 18 days; the largest supermarket in the region is set to close its doors.
^A spokesperson has said this is due to a combination of safety concerns, cooling costs and a lack of fresh produce.
c-2: ^A third major river has been dammed by residents in the North, cutting off an already dwindling water supply to those in the South.
^At the scene of the latest damming, two people were arrested by local police after an altercation led to the serious injury of at least three locals.

Depart: ^As Parker shuts down his computer and gathers himself to leave his phone buzzes and chokes out a high pitched whine.

b: ^It's a message. 'MEET AT ADMISSIONS. FIVE MINUTES - D'
^That would be Parker's supervisor, Dr Grace.
^There are two notifications on the phone.
^The first is an alarm notification: 'CHECK ON BEN IN ROOM 706 BEFORE ROUNDS START.'
^Parker should have plenty of time to get to the ward and see Ben before his doctor makes the rounds to check on him.
^The second is a message: 'MEET AT ADMISSIONS. FIVE MINUTES - D'

c-1: ^"Would you shut that damn thing off?!"

^"Sorry. This heat. These hours. These patients. I'm just tired and cranky. I don't mean - I'm just - I'm sorry. This place is too busy for you to ignore your phone like that. If any of the seniors or, god forbid, any of the nurses see you, Jesus. Just, answer it, okay?"

b: ^That would be Parker's supervisor, Dr Grace.
^There are two notifications on the phone.
^The first is an alarm notification: 'CHECK ON BEN IN ROOM 706 BEFORE ROUNDS START.'
^The second is a message: 'MEET AT ADMISSIONS. FIVE MINUTES - D'
^That would be Parker's supervisor, Dr Grace.
^Parker glances up at the clock. Ward rounds start soon.

c-0: ^Parker grabs his stethoscope and steps out of the office.
c-1: ^Parker grabs his stethoscope and slips out the office door. Room 706 is on the seventh floor.
^He makes for the elevator, avoiding the dark eyed nurses as they rush to and from patients.
^Looks like Parker will need to talk to them.
g-0: ^An orderly is waving at Parker. He's a thin man bogged beneath the weight of an armful of bedpans.
^"Dr Grace was looking for you. You'd better not keep her waiting."

c-0: ^"Can't tell. She has that stabby look in her eye, but that could be a good thing or a bad thing. Best bust a move anyway."

g-0: ^Nurses and admin everywhere make Parker's path difficult. Everyone is in motion. Shifts are changing, doctors are arguing, patients are complaining, bed alerts are beeping.

Admissions: ^Admissions is the only room in the hospital which lacks the constant and nose grating scent of bleach and disinfectant. Instead it is swamped with the smell of the sick and the sweaty.
^There isn't an immediate sign of Dr Grace and Parker glances at the time on his phone. There's still time.

b: ^The Emergency Wait Room is spilling outwards with people. As Parker enters he has to squeeze past a mother holding an injured child, push by an unwisely positioned pram, and duck under the poorly bandaged arm of a man in an orange vest.

^A crowd of what must be more than seventy is crammed into a room made to hold less than half of that. The cacophony is incredible as everyone talks over one another. Only snippets of conversations breach the waves of noise.
^"...in God's name is it this hot? How?"
^"...is that a bruise? I think it's a bruise. Don't poke it!"
^"...no, no water, no work, no one taking money."

c-0: ^There's no sign of her. A few nurses can be seen slowly moving through patients but no one looks remotely like a doctor.
^Parker is suddenly aware that some of the patients have begun looking at him expectantly. An elderly woman nearby eyes his stethoscope. She speaks but her words are washed away in the noise.

^Aware of the repercussions of bucking whatever system the nurses have in place, Parker chooses to ignore the old woman. As much as he wants to help. He does his best to ignore the scowls from the other patients and the look of pained rejection in the old woman's eye.
^Parker will try and send a nurse over to check on her as soon as he has a moment.
c-1: ^Parker leans in closer to speak with the woman.
^"Hey! I've been waiting for longer than she has!"
^"And I've been waiting longer than you!"
^Before Parker can react a nurse pulls him aside.
^"These people are stressed and volatile. We have a triage system and they'll all be seen in that order. Don't freaking mess with it, Parker."
^Parker pulls out his phone and hits call. Over the noise he can barely hear it ring.
c-2: ^Parker is suddenly aware that some of the patients have begun looking at him expectantly. An elderly woman nearby eyes his stethoscope. She's trying to speak but her words are washed away in the noise.

c-0: ^Aware of the repercussions of bucking whatever system the nurses have in place, Parker chooses to ignore the old woman. As much as he wants to help. He does his best to ignore the scowls from the other patients and the look of pained rejection in the old woman's eye.

b: ^The alert rings the moment Parker steps into Admissions. Once, it was a cause for alarm. Now, a call for action.

^The Emergency Wait Room is teeming with people. A crowd of what looks to be more than seventy is pushed into a room made to hold less than half of that. The cacaphony is incredible. Snippets of conversations breach the waves of noise.
^The alert rings, cutting through the conversations.

TheAdmission: ^Parker scans the crowd but finds no other doctors. He's it.
^The nurses all look to the ambulance entry. One turns to look at Parker.

^The patient wheeled in on the stretcher is barely conscious. Female. Middle-aged. Custodial by her clothes. She's breathing heavily, rapidly, her eyes are sunken. There's a drip in her arm with some dark bruising. Looks like the paramedic isn't quite skilled at needles.
^A young girl holds on to the stretcher. Daughter. Asian. Malaysian? Thai? Parker isn't sure. It doesn't matter.
^What he is sure of is what ails the woman on the stretcher. He's seen it every day for months. The state of the daughter only confirms it.
^He ignores the handover the paramedic unloads onto the nearest nurse.
^"She's dehydrated. Severely. You know the drill. Fluids and up her drip. Monitor the oxygen sats and her vitals. And get the daughter a drip too. And a drink."

^The charge nurse takes over from there. He barks orders to the others and the woman and her daughter are taken through to the assessment unit. As the doors close behind them, Parker catches a glimpse of what lies beyond. Row after row of patients, all hooked up to drips. With beds overflowing and hospital capacity blowing past 160%, some are making do with pop up camping chairs.
^Parker turns to find Dr Grace waiting.

c-0: ^"Dr Grace, what can I do for you?"
g-0: ^Her long hair is tied up in an effort to curb the humidity but in defiance stray curls have begun to frizz.

DrGrace: ^"First, have you heard from Anna? A text, email, phone call? Shit, have you had a letter from her? A postcard?"

c-1: ^The last message received from Anna was from a week ago. Asking Parker to email through a report on a patient.
^"I don't really know her. We aren't close or social outside of the hospital."
g-0: ^"She didn't show up to work yesterday. Today is her second day of being AWOL. She hasn't called. Texted. Anything. That leaves her juniors unattended for the second day. After what happened yesterday I've pulled them both off the ward and redistributed their patient load."

c-0: ^"Amongst the other available doctors? I'm sure they're all incredibly happy to receive more patients on their wards."
c-2: ^Parker remains silent and waits for Dr Grace to continue.
g-0: ^"We can't afford to have the juniors doing nothing. So you've volunteered to take them. You're very kind."

c-0: ^"That doesn't sound like me. I'm more of a non-training kind of doctor."

^"And I'm meant to be in my private practice. But here we are. Me, with enough paperwork to do that I would admit myself for carpal tunnel if I wasn’t so damn sure I would be waiting for nine hours to be treated here. And you, about to join the glorious ranks of teaching doctors."
c-1: ^"Do you have anyone else in mind? Perhaps some of the other registrars already looking after overflowing patient loads? Do you think you might have a better solution than my one?"
c-2: ^"Good. If this place is going to survive this we're going to need more 'yes men'."
g-0: ^There's something in her voice that says she won't forget Parker's response anytime soon.

c-0: ^"If you have a problem with it you can take it up with Anna. If you can reach her."
g-0: ^"I have a hospital to run. Good luck."

b: ^"Oh, and if you still have an issue, know that I'm too busy to care, and that as long as you're a doctor, the hospital always comes first. Always."

^"If that's an issue tell that to the kids I don’t have. To the empty holiday home I haven’t visited in over a year. Tell that to someone who has a job which balances their life. You won’t find anyone like that here, not today, not anymore. Except maybe Anna, wherever the hell she is."

g-0: ^She turns on her heel and leaves.
^Before Parker can do anything his phone buzzes. It's the ward 7 nurse.
^"Parker - you have 10 until J starts rounds."

c-0: ^It doesn't ring but a cheerful voice starts talking. "Hi, you've reached Anna. If this is within work hours, call back in five or leave me a message."
^"Hi Anna, it's going a little crazy here. Grace has been looking for you."
^"I've got your juniors for the day. Give me a call if you can, just to let us know what's going on."
c-1: ^"Anna, what the hell, you can't leave the hospital in the lurch here. I'm stuck with your juniors for the day or until you get yourself sorted and let us know what's going on. Call me or Dr Grace as soon as you can."
^Parker opts not to leave a message.

c-0: ^"Hey Anna, hope everything is okay. Got your juniors so don't worry. Call when you can. It's Parker."
c-1: ^"Anna, everyone is flat out here, no one has time to chase you. Call us now."

BensRoomOpening: ^Ward 7 lacks the violent noise of the lower floors. It's a small ward, overcrowded like all of the others but the majority of the patients slumber in silence. Only the metronomic pulses from the monitors break the calm.
^Parker gives a brief nod to the nurse at the reception. She in turn taps her watch.
^The patient in room 706 is gaunt but bright. He lies on his side, eyes closed, as Parker enters and picks up the chart at the end of his bed.
^"You aren't the spongebath I ordered. Although, buddy, if you got the sponge, I am good to go,"

c-0: ^"Please don't tell me you talk to your carers like that."
^"Nah, I behave. But when it's so hot you have to kick your sheet off all the time, the nurses here have seen all there is to see anyway."
c-1: ^"Of course, I need to warn you though, if I start to laugh it's a reflex response and in no way related to anything anatomical."
^"Oh, cool. A penis joke. Do they often tell you to make fun of your bed ridden patients?"
c-2: ^"Don't come in here and give me the silent treatment, come on."

^"You going to tell me what that file of mine says?"

c-0: ^"It says your memory is still a bit fuzzy."
^"There's no guarantee. We'll try and work at it but it could stay that way. Some memories may have been lost forever."
^"Jesus, I feel like I should be bummed about that."
^Ben looks like he will remember that. But his notes suggest he might not.
c-1: ^"Of course. It will just take time."
^Ben looks like he will remember that. His notes suggest that he might not.
^"It says you'll be okay. A bit of mental and physical therapy and you'll be on your way."
^Ben looks like he will remember that. His notes suggest that he might not. And Parker might have told him that exact lie the day before when Ben asked that exact question.

c-0: ^"Dr Parker where should we meet you? - Caroline"
^It must be one of Parker's new charges. He puts the phone back into his pocket.
g-0: ^There's a dulled bang. Parker looks out the window where a plume of smoke rises above the city, far on the other side.

c-0: ^Parker peers out over the city. It's not the first explosion he's heard this week. The air shimmers in the heat, obscuring any view he might have. He can see the smoke though, choked with dust and reaching into the air.
g-0: ^"The news says it's something to do with the heat. Sometimes it's an overclocked AC unit exploding. Sometimes it's a car engine overheating. People are trying to cope any way they can. Hopefully no one was hurt but we'll find out soon enough if they were."

c-0: ^"Company incoming." It's the charge nurse on the ward.
g-0: ^"I've seen people painting their rooftops white. That have anything to do with it?"

c-0: ^"A bit yeah, some people think it will reflect the heat. Like putting a bandaid on a cancer patient though."
c-1: ^He waits a moment for Parker to answer.
g-0: ^"The whole thing makes our job here a lot harder."

c-0: ^"The heat makes people do strange things. I'm not sure if it's a combination of heat stroke and lack of food - yeah, turns out crops don't do so well when seasonal cycles change up. Whatever it is, people are having more accidents."
^"They're hurting each other. They're hurting themselves. No one's really fixing anything. Except us. But we patch people up and we send them away. Until they do it again."
c-1: ^It's probably best not to worry Ben too much.
g-0: ^"It's weird, you know, waking up to all of this. I wake up now and I'm years older than I remember, it's hot as all hell, and the world feels like the beginning of Mad Max. See, I remember Mad Max."

c-0: ^"It is pretty bad out there. They made another one too."
^"Like, with the same actor and everything?"
^"Uh, no. We don't really talk about Mel anymore. New guy. New cast."
^"Does it bode well for us then, based on that movie, if that's where we're heading?"
c-1: ^"Nah, everything is going to be fine. People are working on solutions. Nothing like lighting a fire above the heads of politicians to actually get them to do something."

^From down the corridor comes a voice.

^"Nothing. If it wasn't for my leg and being in here I probably wouldn't even know I'd been in one."
^"I'll have a look and see what I can find to help you, Ben. We'll see what we can do."
^"It's bothered me though, that I've been awake for two days and no one has come to see me except you and Dr Jude the Dude. Is there no one else who wonders about me?"

c-0: ^"Not cool. She's your doctor. Don't be an ass. You probably don't remember her properly anyway."

Judith: ^Dr Judith Chung stands in the doorway. Her short hair remains straight and pointed, unruffled by the humidity. Her eyes narrow at Parker. He stifles the urge to diagnose her on sight.
^"Dr Parker, I thought you were babysitting today."

c-1: ^"Dr Chung, you are looking well today."

^"I am well, actually. Bright and early morning rounds, checking on all of these lazy sleepers. While you're here, perhaps you could offer your assistance? I don't want to overexert myself and end up with wrinkles. What self respecting patient would take me seriously? The only one of them that's awake?"

RippingHimANewOne: ^"Leaving? I'm actually glad you're here. I was hoping to get your professional opinion on a patient or two."

c-0: ^"I know I'm, you know, sort of an expert on all of this but there are just some things which allude me. I need a less experienced set of eyes. Perhaps a pair that don't quite know what they're doing."

g-0: ^"Take this one for instance. If you look closely at this one, you might be able to offer your opinion of just what you think you're doing on my ward."

c-1: ^"This isn't your ward. You aren't in charge."
g-0: ^"I don't care. I am perfectly capable of handling my patients. Your input is unnecessary. And if you screw up my research I can guarantee a storm of shit falling on you. You want to see one of my patients, you come and see me."

b: ^She turns towards Ben and picks up his chart. Sure that the conversation is over, Parker leaves the room.
^She pushes past Parker and into room 706. Sure that the coversation is over, Parker steps out of the doorway.

Intro1: ^Two young doctors stand leaning against the wall. Both straighten up as Parker steps out. The male is not trying to hide his amusement. His colleague stands stonefaced beside him.
Intro2: ^Two young doctors stand waiting in the hallway, undoubtly having heard everything that just went on in Room 706. The male is not even trying to hide his amusement. His colleague stands with her face down beside him.
IntroPoint1: ^"We're Anna's house surgeons, I'm Caroline. This is Ibrahim."
^"Can I just say, that was wow brutal."
^"Come on, we were looking everywhere for him and he's busy getting chewed out in the nap ward by Dr Chung."
^"Right? Could you imagine having her as your supervisor? No offence, Doc."

c-0: ^"We know, we've only been looking for you for the last ten minutes."

c-0: ^"This here is the top of the class, first in everything."

c-0: ^Parker strains his brain to think of an action film...
c-1: ^"If you feel like a romance try La La Land." he quickly messages.
c-2: ^Parker can't even remember the last time he watched a comedy.
c-3: ^"Try Get out. It'll educate you a bit."

g-0: ^Parker waves Caroline over. She finishes checking the drip on the patient and excuses herself, leaving Ibrahim to take the patient to a nurse.
^"Not really my strong suit. Ibrahim might though."
^"That seems...how did you find that patient?"
^Before Caroline can answer Ibrahim bursts through the door. He looks at Caroline and Parker and quietly closes the door behind him.

c-0: ^"Just fine is good enough for now. You each have weakpoints to work on."
c-1: ^"Anna has done a good job prepping the two of you, you'll do well."
^Both doctors seem pleased. Ibrahim looks a little too pleased with himself.
c-2: ^"You both need work. But with everything the way it is here, you'll have to learn on the go."

Parker: ^Parker heads towards the ambulance entrance. His phone buzzes again.

c-0: ^It's from Dr Grace: "Leave the newbies behind for this one."
^Parker breathes a sigh of relief. It's a good thing he chose to go.
g-0: ^He arrives at the ambulance entrance as the siren cuts through the humid air. Dr Grace, mopping  her forehead with a sponge, is already waiting for him. As are a crowd of nurses.

c-0: ^Dr Grace looks solemn. "It's one of ours."
g-0: ^The doors open and the patient is wheeled in. already nurses are moving to take over from the paramedics.
^Dr Grace takes a look at the patient and winces. "I need you on this. Keep your juniors away from her."

^The nurses brief Parker as they wheel the patient towards a space in the emergency room. The patient is suffering from intense dehydration and physical trauma. Bruising along a significant part of her body. Third degree burns on one side.
^At first Parker doesn't recognize her when he moves to take over from the nurses. It's only when he takes the patient's arm to check the line that he sees her name on her wristband.

Ibrahim: ^"I dont think that was the best idea. Ibrahim isn't the best doctor in the world. He's a pass. Like, a bare pass. That's why he's partnered to me."

c-0: ^"He will be fine. It's just an admission. Some paperwork. The nurses will do most of it."

HurryCaroline: ^Parker can hear the ambulance siren nearby before he's even close to the entrance.
^He spies Dr Grace waiting. She shoots him a dark look. Caroline is standing beside her, ready to go. A crowd of nurses reach for the door as paramedics wheel the patient through.
^The patient's in terrible shape. He can see burns, bruising, and that the patient is female. Late twenties. Tall.
^At first Parker doesn't recognize her when he moves to take over from the nurses. It's only when he takes the patient's arm to check the line that he sees her name on her wristband.

^Caroline sees it first. She turns away, her gloved hands to her face. She hasn't noticed the blood on them. Parker can see the panic in her eyes. He's seen it before. When a doctor has to work on someone they know.
^Parker doesn't have time to help her. He just regrets trying to send her in his place.
HurryIbrahim: ^Parker can hear the ambulance siren nearby before he's even close to the entrance.
^He spies Dr Grace waiting. She shoots him a dark look. Ibrahim is standing beside her, his face twisted in discomfort. A crowd of nurses reach for the door as paramedics wheel the patient through.
^The patient's in terrible shape. He can see burns, bruising, and that the patient is female. Late twenties. Tall.
^At first Parker doesn't recognize her when he moves to take over from the nurses. It's only when he takes the patient's arm to check the line that he sees her name on her wristband.
^Ibrahim sees it first. He takes a step back, sucking in air. He swears loudly.
^Parker recognizes the look in his eyes. He's seen it before. When a doctor has to work on someone they know.
^Parker doesn't have time to help her. He just regrets sending him in Parker's place.

AnnesRoomOpening: ^Within twenty minutes a bed is found for Anna in a private room; a makeshift set up in what must have once been a medicine closet. With space at a premium it was the best an orderly could source.
^She's stable but hasn't regained consciousness. A transfusion, coupled with a rehydrating drip slowly drain into her arm. Blood has already been taken and is on the way to the lab.
^Her belongings, what remained of them after they were cut through to get to her injuries, have been tossed in a brown bag.
^Dr Grace is talking to the officers and paramedics that came in with her while Parker triple checks her vitals.

b: ^Ibrahim holds Anna's chart, peering overtop of it at her.
^He stands as far away from the others as space allows and rarely looks away from Anna.

^Caroline is busying herself with a review of her chart. Her brow is furrowed and she's intensely rechecking everything. The slight tilt of her head tells Parker that she's listening to the conversation Dr Grace is having.
^Parker finds himself glad that he left the juniors behind on this one. The last thing he needs is to try and keep one calm. Or worse, both of them.

c-3: ^There's no one left to talk to.

Police: ^Both cops put their caps on as Parker approaches. They give Dr Grace a brief nod and turn to the door.

c-0: ^"Wait. What do you know about this?"
^Both officers look exhausted. Parker can relate. Still, there are unanswered questions.
^"About what you know. If you have time to let the office know what you find, give them a call. They can lodge a report."
^"We could spend our time doing that. But she's alive and any more time we spend here means someone else might not be so lucky."
^"Yes, we know the feeling. And we will file a report if we find anything of value."
^"I don't want to tell you how to do your jobs but shouldn't you be looking into this sort of thing?"
^"The explosion is being looked into, when and where we can spend the manpower. Any available officers we have, even the junior ones, are monitoring several riots at the banks."
^Dr Grace gives Parker a stern look. The officers both give her another nod and take their leave.
^"Way to be a dick, Parker. Everyone is stretched thin out there."

LetCopsGo: ^Both officers step over the power cables littering the floor and take their leave.
Paramedic: ^Before Parker can ask anything the paramedic holds out a clipboard to him. There's smear of something on the corner of the page.
^"Can you sign off on her care? I need to get back out there."
^She looks exhausted. Her shirt has blood on caked on it.
^Sign the form and let her go.

c-0: ^"She was the lucky one. There were two other people in that building with her. Both DoA.
^"She's got a few cuts and scrapes and you can see the burns. She's dehydrated too. Know what I think? I think she was unconscious long before the explosion."
^Sign the form and let her go.
^"We're pulling in untrained paramedics to help out so we should be fine. It's just, it's busy, you know?"
^Sign the form and let her go.
^She doesn't bother to check the form but takes it and leaves without another word.

c-1: ^She doesn't bother to check the form but takes it and leaves without another word.

Grace: ^"I need to know you can handle this, Parker."

c-0: ^"I'm not sure if I can. All these patients. These juniors. Now Anna. I'm not prepared for this."
^Dr Grace looks hard at Parker. There is no reading her expression.
c-1: ^"Yeah, no problem, of course I can handle this."

EndDiscussion: ^Dr Grace is the last to leave.

c-0: ^Anna looks pained. She continues to sleep.

AnnasStuff: ^Her clothes are ruined. Her phone screen is cracked.
^It has a sliver of battery remaining.
^There are a number from the hospital, both calls and texts.

b: ^"Man, the message I left on her phone was definitely not that nice."
^For a moment Parker is glad he didn't leave a nasty message.
^Caroline says nothing but Parker sees her glare at him.
^Parker looks away from the message. He looks at Anna, blows out his checks, then returns to the phone.
^Parker finds himself feeling pretty happy that he didn't leave a message. He glances at Anna and feels that happiness vanish.

AnnasStuff: ^There are a few outgoing messages. It's an old phone, a work one like Parker's, and each message is stored individually.
^One message talks about a pop up clinic. Was Anna moonlighting?
^Parker closes the phone and pockets it.
AnnaDepart: ^Parker steps out of the makeshift bedroom, formerly medicine closet 1701, and out onto the floor of ward 7. The only ward which had a modicum of space and privacy for Anna.
^Unfortunately for Parker, also the only ward currently being run by Dr Judith Chung.
^"Dr Parker, what exactly are you doing, again on my ward, in a storage closet?"

b: ^"Yeah, I'll meet you down there, boss."
^Caroline stands beside Parker but says nothing.
^Parker finds himself wishing he had someone, anyone to sit through Judith lecturing him.

c-0: ^Parker waves. "Sightseeing. And yell louder, you might be able to wake the patients."
^Parker leaves with Judith calling after him. She'll figure it out eventually. It's not really his problem.
^Something in her voice says she will probably remember this though.

b: ^"She might just kill you for that."

c-1: ^Parker recounts the story of Anna's arrival.
^"I will...keep an eye on her. As best I can."
^Something in her voice suggests she will remember Parker's honesty.
c-2: ^"Special patient, prime minister. Note the pseudonym?"
^Parker gestures to the name stuck on the door. Like prisoners, politicians and celebrities, doctors and staff are admitted under false names. In this case "Reid, Elliot" is written on the door.
^Judith hesitates. "I will...endeavour to keep an eye on the patient as well. Seeing as she is on my ward. For the patient."
^Parker nods his approval, sure that this will come back to bite him when Judith sees Anna.

IbrahimConsole: ^As Parker moves to leave, he notices Ibrahim is still lingering by Anna's side.

c-0: ^"Yeah. No. It's...I wasn't expecting this, you know? And I'm thinking about her here and thinking that, we have to be the ones to fix her. Us. Why us? Why her?"
^"Don't think about the patient as Anna. She's just another patient. And we took the oath. We help those in need. This person is just another person in need of help."
^"You don't have the luxury of working through it. You have to put it aside. There are patients."
c-1: ^"My first time was a lecturer I knew. Scared the hell out of me thinking that I was going to screw something up, that they were real, not just a face that's passing by. Not just a fever that needs to be brought down. It was easier when they weren't real. But every patient should be. Let yourself feel this way about every patient. Use it."

CarolineConsole: ^Caroline is ready at the door. She holds her head high.

c-0: ^"Okay, don't let it interfere with your work."
c-1: ^"I saw your face when you saw Anna. It bothered me when I saw her too."

ReceptionRowdyPatients: ^Four hours later, Parker and his new charges have admitted and treated a number of patients. In an effort to see just how busy the day is, Ibrahim suggested an ongoing tally of how many patients they each see. Considering Parker has needed to oversee several of Ibrahim's interactions with patients and has taken credit for most of their care.
^Parker heads back into reception to pick up their next round of patients, mindful that Ibrahim is still working on his last one while Caroline writes up both of their paperwork by hand.

^His heart drops when he sees that the number of patients waiting to be triaged still stretches out the door. Nurses have rigged up makeshift shade using old sheets. Parker dreads to think about what those sheets have seen in their time.
^"Smith, Nellie. Hoult, Wels. Patel, Patel? Who am I to judge? I'm Dr Parker. If you could all come through please."
^"No, I've been waiting here for six hours! Six! This is bullshit. I've been waiting for longer than she has! I should be next."
^The nearest nurse looks imploringly at Parker.

c-0: ^Parker puts on his best forceful voice. It's never quite sounded natural. "Sir, sit down, or be removed. You can wait like everyone else."

^"I have been waiting like everyone else." He runs his hand over his face and pushes his hair back. Slick with sweat, it stays there. "Don't tell me to sit and wait, I've been sitting and waiting. It's all I've done! All we've done."
^Those around him have a similar look in their eyes. Parker can see it in every face. Exhaustion. Hunger. Anger.
^"Sir, you will be seen, you will all be seen, I promise. We have doctors and nurses working non-stop to make sure you are all okay."
^"No, I demand to be seen, now!"
^Before Parker can respond another man has risen to his feet. "Bull, I should be seen next."
^"Screw that, my daughter has been here since breakfast!"

^In a moment the shoving begins. The mass of patients, some active participants, some unfortunate bystanders, are all moving, pushing, shoving, hitting, others trying desperately to get out of the way.
^Security moves in to separate people but it's clear the three guards are going to struggle.
^It doesn't go well for Parker. The rioting patients are quelled with the help of an airhorn, several nurses, the guards, Parker and four buckets of cold water.

^For his effort Parker receives a black eye. Those patients who were more combative are moved outside to dry off, while the rest nurse their new injuries. Parker leaves them to join his new patients, gingerly touching his new shiner.
c-1: ^Parker leaves the nurses and security to deal with the combative patients.
^"Do you want to be the first one through at an emergency entrance? You want to tell those around you that your case is more urgent than theirs? Or you want to sit down and let us do our jobs?"
^The patient looks uncomfortable. All of the others begin to avoid the gazes of their peers. No one is willing to say that their case is more urgent.
^Parker chooses to leave the nurses to it. As he departs he hears the loudest roaring overtop of the complaints.

ActTwoAdmissions: ^Back in emergency admissions, Parker sends each of his new patients into a consult room to await a doctor.
^Smith, N, 17, looks to have a rash coupled with what is likely cellulitis.
^Hoult, W, 83 is a geriatric patient, mainly presenting with severe dehydration, but the geriatric aspect complicates the case. There may be numerous comorbidities which need to be reviewed.
^Patel, P, 41, probable infection. Blood work will need doing. Should be a simple case.
^Before Parker can distribute the patients, Caroline pops up.
^"The gerry, Hoult, could I take him? It looks like a complex one. You might want to give Ibrahim an easy one too."

c-0: ^"Ibrahim can take Patel. It seems like a simple case."
c-1: ^"No, it's a complex case, I'll hold on to it. You take Smith. We'll keep Ibrahim on the easy ones."
^Caroline looks disappointed but takes the file.

Patients: ^With all of the patients assigned, the three doctors return to the job.

b: ^Parker finds Mr Hoult stretching in the consultation room. Dark sweat stains spatter his shirt and seep out from beneath his armpits.
^"Bloody hot, ain't it? When I was young we had summers far warmer but. Always out of breath now, much harder to deal with it."
^Parker looks at the notes from the nurse. There isn't a whole lot he can do for Mr Hoult that doesn't involve a drip and an admission to an already full geriatric ward.
^Parker's phone buzzes. Thinking it might be about Anna, Parker checks it. It is, just not in the way Parker is expecting. It's from Caroline.
^Parker excuses himself but not before offering Mr Hoult a glass of water and informing him that a nurse will be with him shortly.
^He finds Caroline sitting in her consultation room with Nellie Smith.
^"Parker, Nellie came in looking for a doctor she saw a couple of days ago. Can you tell Dr Parker what you told me?"

^Nellie looks uncomfortable. "I was told I could find a Dr Corona here? Tall, brown lady? Looking after patients with this other doctor guy out in the mall. It's only drug dealers and homeless people there. She gave me some ointment for this thing on my leg and if it got worse to come see her? This lady says she isn't here."
^Parker offers Nellie some water. "She isn't. She hasn't been to work in a while. That was the last time you saw her?"
^"Yeah, two days. She wasn't charging money or anything. Not that it's worth much at the moment. I'd be better off wiping - "
^"Yeah, I know. She say anything else?"
^"Ointment, three times a day. Clean water to wash it."
^"Yeah, let's get you a better cream for that, and get it all cleaned up for you before we wrap it up. You mind waiting back in the wait room for us?"
^As she leaves, Parker checks the details she's filled out on her registration form, making sure there's a contact number.
^"Sounds like your boss was moonlighting, working out in the public. But if she was trying to help patients, why not do it here?"
^Nellie Smith looks disappointed when Parker enters the consultation room.
^"I was hoping for the lady doctor."
^"No, her name started with 'c', like, her last name. She said she worked here? She's the one, she saw me last time."
^"Yeah. She looked at this thing on my leg and gave me ointment for it too. Is she around? No offense."
^"None taken. She's not around I'm afraid. Where did you see her?"

^"She and this other doctor had a little clinic thing in one of the empty malls. She said to come here if I needed to see her again. She didn't charge any money or anything. Not that it's worth much at the moment. I'd be better off wiping - "
^"Yeah, I know. She say anything else?"
^"Ointment, three times a day. Clean water to wash it."
^"That's it. What? She was busy. Do you know how many people show up to a place like that? Free clinics were busy before all of this."
^"Yeah, I know busy. Let's get you a better cream for that, and get it all cleaned up for you before we wrap it up."

^Once Nellie is on her way, Parker takes a moment to write up her notes, triple checking that he has some contact numbers for Nellie. He spies Caroline popping out of her consult room, sending Mr Hoult to a nurse for a drip, then barging into Ibrahim's. At least he can trust her to keep an eye on Ibrahim.
^Parker wonders what Anna was doing, moonlighting in an abandoned mall. Was she just helping sick patients? Why not do it at the hospital?
^Parker greets patel but is interrupted by ibrahim knocking on the door asking him to come and see Smith, who has information about Anna's moonlighting

LateWork: ^Sixty four patients. In a twleve hour shift. Parker can see the toll on the faces of his juniors. He's sure the toll can be seen on his face as well.
^Parker glances at the clock, trying to stifle a yawn. The wait room is still full. The clock has only just hit ten but he calls Caroline and Ibrahim over.
^"The two of you can pack it in. There's no point in wearing yourselves out, we'll be doing the same thing again tomorrow. I'll hold down the fort until the night shift arrives."
^Ibrahim doesn't waste a beat. He's gone. Caroline lingers.
^"I can keep going, just a few more patients to balance it out a bit."

c-0: ^Parker agrees and the two continue to see patients until the evening shift arrives. It's only then that Parker insists that Caroline leave.
^Parker takes a quick stock of the patients still waiting to be seen. The numbers are still extraordinary and many of them are senior citizens and children.
^Parker wishes for a coffee and continues to work into the late hours. It's not until he finds himself dozing on his paperwork that he allows himself to leave.
c-1: ^Parker passes the workload on to the nightshift and calls it a day.
^"No, I need you rested. Look after yourself first. Then the patients."
^Caroline protests but Parker sends her away.
^Parker takes a quick stock of the patients still waiting to be seen. The numbers are still extraordinary and many of them are senior citizens and children.

c-0: ^Parker wishes for a coffee and continues to work into the late hours. It's not until he finds himself dozing on his paperwork that he allows himself to leave.
c-1: ^Parker passes the workload on to the nightshift and calls it a day.

CheckingOnAnna: ^Parker checks Anna's notes. No developments, though he already guessed that when he didn't receive a message all day.
^There's nothing he can do for her at the moment. She just needs to rest.

^Something catches his eye on the shelves behind Anna's bed. Row after row of little white boxes of pills. Parker reaches up to one of the higher shelves and moves some of the boxes aside. Where the count says ten only two boxes sit, carefully positioned to appear as if there are more.
^Parker tries the row of boxes beside it to find the same. And the next. And the next. And the next. Medicines are missing. Lots of them.
^Parker yawns. He can barely think straight. Whatever this is, it can wait.
^He gives Anna one last glance and  slips out the door.
EndChapter: ^Parker knocks gently on the door to 706. There's no answer but he lets himself in anyway. He finds Ben watching him as he enters.
^"Look what the cat dragged in, Mr Rick Parker himself!"
^Parker looks at Ben. He has a strange look in his eyes, almost like he's looking through Parker. Parker saw that same look the night before.
^"Mind if I crash here tonight, Ben?"
^"Yeah buddy, you just make yourself at home. Better than driving home in this weather."
^Ben looks around. He's sweating. "At my place, where else?"
^"What do you remember, Ben? What are you seeing?"
^"It's really cold. Why is it so cold?"
^When Ben stays silent Parker checks his pulse. He checks Ben's pupils. The patient is fine. Just clammy and sleeping.
^Parker check the thermometer on the wall. 32 degrees. He remembers when that sort of heat was an anomaly.
^Parker settles into the visitor's chair. There's a prescription sitting on the table. It's signed Judith Chung.
Ending: ^Thanks for playing episode one! Stay tuned for episode 2!
^Hit the reset button in the top left to start the story from the beginning.
